about_the_game:
Your own virtual workshop stocked with realistically simulated parts and equipment, where you can unleash your creativity and meet other passionate makers online.

Simulate Electronics
Connect a battery to an LED. See the voltage at each point, observe the current flowing through the LED, and watch it glow! Experiment with electronics in a hands-on, interactive way.

Code Robots
Unlock endless possibilities by wiring in a microcontroller. In Wijita, you'll be able to write code that processes inputs from buttons and sensors, control outputs to lights and motors, and bring your very own robot to life. Immerse yourself in the exciting challenges and triumphs of robotics!

Start Understanding
Are you new to the world of electronics? No problem! Wijita is designed to guide you every step of the way through interactive challenges and insightful hints when things don't go as planned.

Stop Interruptions
If you've already tinkered with electronics before, Wijita streamlines your process with data overlays and instant access to the catalog of parts. This means you can focus on what matters – uninterrupted creation and experimentation.

Meet Other Makers
Wijita: City of Makers is more than just a game – it's a community of passionate makers. Tinker to your heart's content and unleash your creativity. When you're ready, open the doors of your virtual workshop and step into a vibrant world where you can meet other makers, share your builds, and get inspired!

Features


Workshop
A virtual space in which to unleash your creativity.

Parts
Batteries, resistors, LEDs, motors, breadboards, microcontrollers, and more.

Microcontroller
Write code to process inputs and control outputs, unlocking endless possibilities.

Challenges and data overlays
Receive guidance and valuable feedback when things don't go as planned.

Opt-in multiplayer
Open the doors to your workshop and explore what other makers are up to.

More parts (Planned)
Capacitor, inductor, servo, stepper motor, radio controller, propeller, ultrasonic sensor, and more.

More challenges (Planned)
Guide you through the use of the breadboard and coding the microcontroller.

3D printer (Planned)
"Print" actual 3D printer files within the game. Integrate the prints into your virtual creations.

Personalization (Planned)
Unleash your personality with furniture and decorations that reflect your unique style.

Competitions (Planned)
Engage in thrilling robot battles and races, testing your creations against fellow makers in friendly competition.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Skylake Core i7-6700HQ
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1060
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 1 GB available space
